about.description: Ligain is a platform for guessing on football matches between friends.
about.alphaNote: It's currently only available for Ligue 1 matches.
about.contactInfo: If you have any feedback, requests or suggestions, please contact me at
about.supportDescription: I'm working alone on this project and it costs me hundreds of euros per year to keep it running. If you enjoy using Ligain, consider tipping me to help support the development!

rules.philosophyDescription1: The idea is simple, being as close as possible to the real match result.
rules.philosophyDescription2: We believe that when a result is 3-0, having predicted 2-1 is not as good as having predicted 2-0.
rules.philosophyDescription3: We also want to reward players who took risks and guessed on the underdog, or were alone in their prediction.
rules.closeScoreDescription: A score is considered close if there is the same goal difference as in the prediction AND the difference in the total goals of both teams between the prediction and the match is less than or equal to 2.
rules.closeScoreExample1: Example : Prediction 2-1, Match 3-2 â†’ 400 points (same goal difference of 1, total differs by 2)
rules.closeScoreExample2: Example : Prediction 1-0, Match 2-1 â†’ 400 points (same goal difference of 1, total differs by 2)
rules.closeScoreExample3: Example : Prediction 2-1, Match 4-3 â†’ 300 points (same goal difference of 1, total differs by 4)
rules.goodResult: â€¢ Good result (neither close nor exact) : 300 points
rules.goodResultExample: Example : Prediction 4-1, Match 1-0 â†’ 300 points (good result but not close)
rules.multipliersDescription1: The idea here is to determine if there is a team which is clearly considered as the favorite, which makes the other the underdog.
rules.multipliersDescription2: The bonus is active only if you have predicted a draw or a win for the underdog.
rules.favoriteWin: â€¢ Favorite win : points Ã— 1 (no multiplier)
rules.oddsDifferenceHighExample: Example : Team A at 1.3 vs Team B at 3.0 Multiplier active because the difference is 1.7
rules.oddsDifferenceLowExample: Example : Team A at 2.0 vs Team B at 2.5 â†’ No multiplier
rules.riskBonus50: â€¢ 50% or less of the players have the same good result : +10%
rules.riskBonus50Example: Example : 2/4 players predict 2-1 and are correct â†’ +10% on their points
rules.riskBonus25: â€¢ 25% or less of the players have the good result : +25%
rules.riskBonus25Example: Example : Only 1/4 players predict 2-1 and are correct â†’ +25% on their points
rules.oddsUpdatesDescription: Odds are updated in real-time based on the latest prediction market data. However, to ensure fair play and prevent last-minute changes that could affect prediction decisions, odds are locked and will not be updated in the last 5 minutes before a match starts.
rules.completeExampleText:
Competition between 4 players
Team A at 1.3 vs Team B at 3.0

The 3 other players predict 2-1
Match : 2-2
